title: Weekend shooting in Chicopee now homicide investigation
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
CHICOPEE, Mass. (WWLP) – Hampden District Attorney Anthony Gulluni confirmed Sunday the shooting incident on Boucher Street is now an active homicide investigation.
On Saturday, July 16, at approximately 12:53 p.m.. the Chicopee Police Department responded to 120 Boucher Street in Chicopee for the report of a disturbance.
Upon arrival, officers discovered a male victim who was later determined to be fifteen years old, with an apparent gunshot wound to the chest. The victim was transported to Baystate Medical Center.
Chicopee Police requested the assistance of the Massachusetts State Police Detective Unit. Members of the SPDU and the Hampden District Attorney’s office responded to the scene.
Through the initial investigation, detectives were able to determine the victim and a friend were consuming alcohol at a near-by home. The investigation indicated that the two friends were apparently confused while walking in the neighborhood.
Shortly after their arrival, the homeowner was alerted to their presence and retrieved his firearm. He then went to his door and where he attempted to communicate with the victim. When a pane of glass broke, the suspect fired a single shot.
Later on Saturday, the victim passed as a result of the gunshot wound.
Hampden District Attorney Anthony Gulluni stated, “This was a tragic and avoidable incident that resulted in a young man losing his life. My sympathy and thoughts are with the victim’s family and friends. I would like to thank the members of the Massachusetts State Police Detective Unit assigned to my office as well as the Chief of the Office’s Homicide unit , Assistant District Attorney Eduardo Velazquez for their immediate response and professional investigation into this unfortunate incident, which has resulted in the arrest of a suspect.”
Arrested was Jeffrey Lovell, 42, of Chicopee Mass. He will be arraigned in Chicopee District Court on Monday on charges of murder.
